intro: Leptospermum sericatum, commonly known as the silver tea tree, is a shrub native to Tasmania. It is characterized by its narrow, silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring, attracting nectar-feeding birds and insects. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and dry forest areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is a valued species in horticulture and conservation efforts.
